Articles.Content:
For the record, I have given express, written permission to @linuxgurugamer to continue VOID, VOID_CareerTracker, TweakableEverything, ToadicusTools, and EVAManager, including rights to use the names of the mods with or without modification, my psuedonym ("toadicus"), and all code, patches, graphics, and/or other assets.  Thanks very much for taking up the mantle, linuxgurugamer!

QuantumStrutsContinued remains free and open source under the terms of the "BSD2" license.  Anyone is free to continue QuantumStrutsContinued under those terms.

I release all code, patches, graphics, and/or other assets for AntennaRange into the public domain.  I dedicate any and all copyright interest in AntennaRange to the public domain.  This is an overt act of relinquishment in perpetuity of all present and future rights to AntennaRange under copyright law.

It's been a joy working with the various mod developers, the developers at Squad, and the whole addon community these past two years.  Thanks to all for your support and encouragement!
are you leaving us? or just stopping moding?
I'm just done modding.  But, that was most of my community involvement, so I'm not sure how much I'll be involved at all anymore.  I'll keep an eye on things for a while longer, at least.

8 minutes ago, toadicus said:

I'm just done modding.  But, that was most of my community involvement, so I'm not sure how much I'll be involved at all anymore.  I'll keep an eye on things for a while longer, at least.

Thanks for passing on your mods to LG, didn't realize fully until 1.1.3 how your mods had crept in to my game and mods, they say the sign of a good mod is that you don't notice it until it's gone, and i certainly noticed when the compatibility was lost.   Thanks for your mods, and good luck with your further adventures

Edited October 12, 2016 by SpannerMonkey(smce)

45 minutes ago, toadicus said:

<snip>
It's been a joy working with the various mod developers, the developers at Squad, and the whole addon community these past two years.  Thanks to all for your support and encouragement!

May I say your mods have been invaluable to so many, many space programs (my own included) and so I thank you sincerely for all your work and effort. I'm also in awe of the example you set in gifting your work into the public domain. Good luck sir. o7

 

May I also note, that @linuxgurugamer has been an absolute machine as of late when it comes to mod maintenance. So many mods I've known and loved that had fallen by the wayside have been returning en masse with his dedication.

Toadicus, I'll just add a very big THANK YOU, as VOID has been invaluable to me for so long i cant remember when I first started using it... It is without a doubt one of the VERY first mods I install, and MUST have... I've also used QuantumStruts since the original, so thank you for continuing that as long as you have...

And Thank You for doing the responsible thing, in not only making an "official" statement that you're done  saying "so long...", but also in handing over the reigns...

I'm sad to see you go, but you have to do what you have to do... KSP, IS just a game/hobby after all...

Best of Luck & Fun to you on whatever follows

Take Care  \o

Edited October 12, 2016 by Stone Blue
